title: Sir Alex Ferguson visits Man Utd training ground and speaks to Solskjaer before Liverpool clash
text:
The Scot dropped into Carrington on Saturday and chatted with the manager (Picture: MUTV)

Sir Alex Ferguson made an appearance at Manchester United’s training ground on Saturday and spent time chatting to manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and assistant Michael Carrick.

The Red Devils are gearing up for a huge clash on Sunday against rivals Liverpool, who have a 100% record in the Premier League this season, while the pressure will ramp up on Solskjaer if he presides over another defeat.

But he might have got a few words of encouragement from his old gaffer, Sir Alex, who watched the Under-18s in action against Middlesbrough.

The legendary Scot was spotted pitch-side at Carrington in deep discussion with Solskjaer and Carrick midway through the first half, with United’s youngsters trailing at the time.

They may have been inspired by the 77-year-old’s appearance, with Anthony Elanga scoring a late equaliser in Fergie Time to secure a point for the young Reds.

Sir Alex is believed to have played a key role in the decision to appoint Solskjaer on a temporary basis when Jose Mourinho was sacked, and the Norwegian has often spoken about how big an influence he has been.

‘He’s influenced me with everything to be fair,’ he explained when he first took over at United.

‘The way he’s dealt with people, the way he was the manager of the club, how he kept 25 international players happy, hungry and wanting to improve. But also the staff in and around the place.

‘He’s been my mentor. From my injury in 2003 at least, I was making all the notes, what he did in different, certain situations. Of course I’ve already been in touch with him, because there’s no one better to get some advice from.’

Liverpool have not won at Old Trafford in five years and Solskjaer must continue that run (Getty)

Unfortunately for Solskjaer, United’s poor form has meant he’s had to borrow Ferguson’s ‘hairdryer treatment’ more recently, laying into his players after their last defeat to Newcastle.

While another loss – even a heavy won – against Liverpool at Old Trafford is not expected to be fatal to Solskjaer’s United career, anything but three points in the subsequent match against Norwich could see his time at the club come to a premature end.
